Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a single photo of a hospital bill without any additional evidence or context.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the enormous hospital bill is solely due to the treatment of COVID-19, which is not supported by the evidence provided.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19, as confirmed by the hospital spokesperson.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the high hospital bill, which is the treatment for severe aplastic anemia, tuberculosis, and pneumonia, as stated in the fundraising campaign.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the impact of the hospital bill by presenting it as a result of COVID-19 treatment without considering other medical conditions.
Understate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim understates any aspect of the situation.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing sufficient evidence or considering alternative explanations.
